Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Rabbi Kenneth A. Stern, Park Avenue Synagogue, 50 East 87th Street, New York, New York  10128.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Brewer.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rabbi Kenneth A. Stern, Park Avenue Synagogue, 50 East 87th Street, New York, N.Y. 10128.

Council Member Brewer moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 28, 2007 be adopted and printed by Council Member Vann.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Vann moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 28, 2007 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member de Blasio:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application Number C 070134 PPK, shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Disposition of one city-owned property, located at 299 DeGraw Street, Borough of Brooklyn. (C070134PPK)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Mark-Viverito:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application Number C 070133 PPM, shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Disposition of one city-owned property, located at 120 East 125th Street, Borough of Manhattan. (C070133 PPM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Sanders:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application Number C 070136 PPQ, shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Disposition of one city-owned property, located at 58-03 Rockaway Beach Boulevard, Borough of Queens. (C070136PPQ)

Items.Title: Resolution approving the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 060381 ZSM (L.U. No. 427), for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Sections 13-562 and 74-52 of the Zoning Resolution to allow an attended public parking garage with a maximum capacity of 190 spaces on portions of the ground floor and cellar of a proposed mixed use building on property located at 555 West 59th Street (Block 1151, Lots 5, 9, 51, 52, and 53), in a C6-2 District, within the Special Clinton District.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 427 - ULURP, 555 W. 59th Street, Manhattan (C060381ZSM)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Environmental Protection Agency to abandon its technically and scientifically flawed 2006 Test and Clean Program, and work with residents and workers, community and labor organizations and elected officials to design an effective, science-based sampling and cleanup program for residences and workplaces in Lower Manhattan, Brooklyn and all affected areas.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Lower Manhattan Redevelopment
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: US Environmental Protection Agency to abandon its technically and scientifically flawed 2006 Test and Clean Program.

Items.Title: Resolution denouncing the massacre at the Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University located in Blacksburg, Virginia, expressing outrage at the senseless casualties suffered by students and faculty, and offering solidarity and support to the Virginia Tech and Blacksburg communities.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Denouncing the massacre at the Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University located in Blacksburg, Virginia.

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the use of non-wood bats.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress, the Governor of the State of New York and the New York State Legislature to ensure the continued operation of 21st Century Community Learning Centers.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Youth Services
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: US Congress, the Governor of the State of NY and the NYS Legislature to ensure the continued operation of 21st Century Community Learning Centers.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution denouncing the massacre at the Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University located in Blacksburg, Virginia, expressing outrage at the senseless casualties suffered by students and faculty, and offering solidarity and support to the Virginia Tech and Blacksburg communities.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Denouncing the massacre at the Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University located in Blacksburg, Virginia.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.1865, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.3873, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the retirement and social security law, in relation to pensions of registered nurse and midwife members of the New York city employees’ retirement system”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Pensions of registered nurse and midwife members of NYCERS (S.1865, A.3873).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Lanza, S.4239, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.7336, “AN ACT to amend the civil service law, in relation to the suspension of certain employees in cities having a population of one million or more”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Suspension of certain employees in cities having a population of one million or more (S.4239, A.7336).

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the sale of personal watercraft and specialty prop-craft.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Waterfronts
Items.MatterName: Sale of personal watercraft and specialty prop-craft.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a New York city energy code.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Establishing a New York city energy code.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting employment discrimination based on an individual’s actual or perceived status as a caregiver.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to adopt S. 2644 and A. 5178, legislation which would make certain persons who are eligible for or receiving social security disability insurance (SSDI) benefits eligible for the Elderly Pharmaceutical Insurance Coverage (EPIC) program.

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse and Disability Services

This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called up by vote of the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Planning, Dispositions and Concessions
Items.MatterName: ULURP, 136 Wythe Avenue, Brooklyn (C20070135 PPK)

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:
Override item Int No. 331-A, 
Override item Int No. 341-A.

See files for individual votes.

Notwithstanding the objection of the Mayor, both Int No. 331-A and Int No. 341-A 
were re-adopted by the Council.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.Title: Zoning resolution amendment application no. C 050037 ZMQ, pursuant to Sections 197-d and 201 of the New York City Charter, for an amendment of the Zoning Map, Section Nos. 9d and 10b.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning Reso., Corona Ave./Junction Blvd., Queens (C050037ZMQ)

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote:
At this point, the Speaker (Concil Member Quinn) asked for a moment of silence in memory of the following individuals:

The 32 individuals who were shot and killed on the campus of Virginia Tech on April 16, 2007 in the deadliest shooting in U.S. history.
